main event: Multiple witnesses reported seeing a bright light in the sky which later exhibited rapid movement and pulsating orange color in Arlington, Virginia.
interesting points: The objects were initially mistaken for stars before exhibiting extraordinary brightness and movement,The observation lasted for about 15 seconds with the light traveling in a straight line before disappearing,Witnesses described the moving lights as having a disk-like shape with a speed estimated in thousands of miles per hour,The sighting possibly involved reflections from a weather balloon, leading to misinterpretation of the event, The investigation concluded that the sightings could be explained as the behavior of a weather balloon rather than an unidentified flying object.
sighted object: a bright light and possibly a saucer-shaped object
witness description: One witness was a 35-year-old retired individual and the other was a minister educated at the post-graduate level; both had an interest in astronomy.
